remarks: Sylow's second theorem.  Putting together the results of ~ sylow2a and the orbit-stabilizer theorem to show that ` P ` does not divide the set of all fixed points under the group action, we get that there is a fixed point of the group action, so that there is some ` g e. X ` with ` h g K = g K ` for all ` h e. H ` .  This implies that ` invg ( g ) h g e. K ` , so ` h ` is in the conjugated subgroup ` g K invg ( g ) ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)
